model-value.desc: When set as `YYYY-MM-DD`, the calendar will display the current view on this date. If empty, then it will be changed to the current date which will be emitted. Either use this property (along with a listener for 'update:modelValue' event) OR use v-model directive

model-tasks.desc: An array of Tasks that will be displayed

model-footer.desc: An array of footer items, each will be displayed via a slot in the footer (summary) area

view.desc: Tells the calendar how to display the data

view-count.desc: The number of views to show. For instance, if the property `view` was `week`, then setting this property to 2 would show 2 weeks.

task-width.desc: The number of pixels needed for the tasks column

now.desc: This is the currently displayed date (highlighted). If not set, then the current date is used

weekdays.desc: This is the days of the week and in which order they are displayed. If you want Monday as the first day of the week, you would use [1,2,3,4,5,6,0]. If you want a 5-day work week you would use [1,2,3,4,5]

date-type.desc: Shows the current date button as either a circle or a square

weekday-align.desc: Determines the weekday (ie: Sunday, Monday, etc) alignment

date-header.desc: Determines how the date header will be displayed

bordered.desc: Places a border around the calendar

dark.desc: Places the calendar into dark mode

no-aria.desc: Turns off automatical generation of aria labels for timestamps

no-active-date.desc: This controls whether the `q-active-date` css class is set when a user clicks on a date label (button)

short-weekday-label.desc: Displays the weekday label in short format. For instance, 'Monday' would become 'Mon'

no-default-header-text.desc: Do not display the weekday text in the header

no-default-header-btn.desc: Do not display the date button in the header

min-weekday-label.desc: The minimal number of weekday characters when truncation occurs

weekday-breakpoints.desc: The breakpoint widths where weekday truncation occurs (needs 2 values)

locale.desc: Used to change the locale of the calendar. Any acceptable locale can be used that is recognized by the browser. If the locale fails, then 'en-US' is the fallback

transition-prev.desc: When animated property is true, transition to use for previous calendar display

transition-next.desc: When animated property is true, transition to use for next calendar display

disabled-days.desc: An array of string dates in the form `YYYY-MM-DD` that will be disabled. If an array is contained within the array with a start and end date, it will be treated as a range

disabled-before.desc: A date in the form `YYYY-MM-DD` where all dates before, and including, will be disabled

disabled-after.desc: A date in the form `YYYY-MM-DD` where all dates after, and including, will be disabled

disabled-weekdays.desc: Similar to `weekdays` property, except values included in this array are automatically made disabled

drag-enter-func.desc: The function to handle dragenter events

data.desc: The data passed to the function

scope.desc: The scope data passed to the function

column.desc: The column object used to build the column

days.desc: An array of Timestamp objects representing the days associated with the column(s)

timestamp.desc: For 'head-day'. The Timestamp object associated with the date

drag-over-func.desc: The function to handle dragover events. You must call in your `e.preventDefault()` for Drag and Drop to work properly

event.desc: The event associated with the dragover

data.desc: The data passed to the function

scope.desc: The scope data passed to the function

column.desc: The column object used to build the column

days.desc: An array of Timestamp objects representing the days associated with the column(s)

timestamp.desc: For 'head-day'. The Timestamp object associated with the date

drag-leave-func.desc: The function to handle dragleave events

event.desc: The event associated with the dragleave

data.desc: The data passed to the function

scope.desc: The scope data passed to the function

column.desc: The column object used to build the column

days.desc: An array of Timestamp objects representing the days associated with the column(s)

timestamp.desc: For 'head-day'. The Timestamp object associated with the date

drop-func.desc: The function to handle drop events

event.desc: The event associated with the drop

data.desc: The data passed to the function

scope.desc: The scope data passed to the function

column.desc: The column object used to build the column

days.desc: An array of Timestamp objects representing the days associated with the column(s)

timestamp.desc: For 'head-day'. The Timestamp object associated with the date

selected-dates.desc: An array of string dates in the form `YYYY-MM-DD` that will be selected. Interval-based calendars use `YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm`

selected-start-end-dates.desc: An array of two dates in format `YYYY-MM-DD` for selection purposes. Interval-based calendars use `YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm`

hoverable.desc: Allows certain cells within the calendar to be hovered

focusable.desc: Allows certain cells within the calendar to receive focus

weekday-style.desc: Gets called to provide custom styling of a weekday

data.desc: The data passed to the function

scope.desc: The scope data passed to the function

timestamp.desc: A timestamp object associated with the weekday

droppable.desc: Value is set by return value of a drag and drop function

weekday-class.desc: Gets called to provide custom styling (via classes) of a weekday

data.desc: The data passed to the function

scope.desc: The scope data passed to the function

timestamp.desc: A timestamp object associated with the weekday

droppable.desc: Value is set by return value of a drag and drop function

returns.desc: A Vue style object of classes

day-height.desc: The maximum height in pixels for the day height. Using 0 will make the rows variable height based on content.

day-min-height.desc: The minimum height to be used

max-days.desc: The number of days to be displayed

cell-width.desc: Sets day cell width and turns on sticky mode. Width is assumed to be in pixels

update:modelValue.desc: Emitted when the component needs to change the model; Is also used by v-model

change.desc: Emitted when the calendar dates change for the current view

{start, end}.desc: The timestamp objects for the first and last valid dates being displayed

moved.desc: Emitted when the date is moved

timestamp.desc: The Timestamp object of the move

data.desc: The data passed to the function

scope.desc: The scope object passed to the function

timestamp.desc: A timestamp object associated with the weekday

droppable.desc: Value is set by return value of a drag and drop function

prev.desc: Triggers the calendar to show the previous view

next.desc: Triggers the calendar to show the next view

move.desc: Triggers component to move for count iterations, depending on positive (forwards) or negative (backwards) value

updateCurrent.desc: Update various values to be consistent with current date

day.desc: For rendering associated Task information on that day

data.desc: The bundled data

scope.desc: The scope object

timestamp.desc: Timestamp object

task.desc: the Task associated with this row
The slot associated with the task

scope.desc: The scope object

start.desc: A timestamp object of the starting date

end.desc: A timestamp object of the ending date

head-task.desc: The slot associated with task header

end.desc: A timestamp object of the ending date

index.desc: the index into the array item from model `footer-tasks`

footer-day.desc: The slot associated with task footer for a particular day

scope.desc: The scope object

timestamp.desc: A timestamp object of the day

index.desc: the index into the array item from model `footer-tasks`

head-weekday-label.desc: The slot associated with the header weekday label

scope.desc: The scope object

timestamp.desc: A timestamp object of the day

head-day-label.desc: The slot associated with the day label. Replaces the label of the button

timestamp.desc: A timestamp object of the day

dayLabel.desc: The string value that would have been used for the day label

activeDate.desc: true if this is the active date

head-day-button.desc: The slot associated with the day button. Replaces the whole button

scope.desc: The scope object

timestamp.desc: A timestamp object of the day

dayLabel.desc: The string value that would have been used for the day label

activeDate.desc: true if this is the active date

head-day.desc: The slot associated with the head day. Replaces everything in the head day

scope.desc: The scope object

timestamp.desc: A timestamp object of the day

activeDate.desc: true if this is the active date

head-date.desc: The slot associated with the head date. Used to append to the head day

dayLabel.desc: The string value that would have been used for the day label
